info.name: Inferior colliculus
info.description: The inferior colliculi are paired rounded structures on the superior surface of the caudal midbrain formed by the paired nuclei of the inferior colliculus.  Along with the paired superior colliculi in the rostral midbrain, they form the tectum or roof of the midbrain and are collectively referred to as the corpora quadrigemina. The inferior colliculus is an important synapse in the auditory pathway, receiving auditory input from the lateral lemniscus and sending its output via the brachium of the inferior colliculus to synapse in the medial geniculate nucleus of the thalamus.
